intro.content:
Hey {{ contact.FIRSTNAME }}, how are you doing?

This week, I have been collecting multiple articles and videos about art, sport and, last but not least, cute animals (be sure to checkout the marmot one!).

I hope you do enjoy this selection and have a wonderful weekend!

hero.title: Life Size Balloon T-Rex Dinosaur
hero.why:
“6 time World Champion balloon artist Mark Verge makes cool balloons for a living”
Okay, wait, wait, wait, let’s pause for a minute and reprocess this sentence:
Primo, there is a World championship for balloons. Secondo this guy won 6 times (!). Tertio, he is living from it.
Truly incredible!

randomArticles.description: A selection of BBC's readers pictures of Scotland sent in between 15 and 22 January.
randomArticles.title: Scotland in pictures

randomArticles.description: Danny Macaskill testing the limits of mountain biking, riding down the infamous Dubh Slabs on the Isle of Skye
randomArticles.title: Danny MacAskill - The Slabs

randomArticles.description: This gothic chapel located in Paris was built between 1238 and 1248 CE.
randomArticles.title: 3D Scan of the Sainte-chapell

randomArticles.description: Nathan Myhrvold has developed a camera that captures snowflakes at a microscopic level never seen before
randomArticles.title: These Are the Highest Resolution Photos Ever Taken of Snowflake

randomArticles.description: Have you ever wondered what these tiny doors at the Capitol are for?
randomArticles.title: The Tiny Doors in the U.S. Capitol

animalCorner.description: The now famous French marmots are doing sport… Among other things.
animalCorner.title: "Compilation marmottes" on France 3

animalCorner.description: How did these solitary, fierce predators become our sofa sidekicks?
animalCorner.title: The history of the world according to cats

animalCorner.description: Parrot gets SO excited when his dad takes him to his favorite place
animalCorner.title: Parrot Loves Going To Home Depot With His Dad

recipe.title: Sushi Bake Is the Lockdown Trend I’ll Never Stop Making
recipe.description: Sushi bake is good for dinner at home now, great for (eventual) potlucks in the future.
